Package com.github.actionfx.core.utils

Class AFXUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.actionfx.core.utils.AFXUtils
  • public class AFXUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    Util-class for working with JavaFX. This class comes with some handy routines for e.g. loading FXML, working with the JavaFX thread or just controlling the behavior of certain nodes depending on the binding.
    Author:
    MartinKoster

      • loadFxml

        public static final <T> T loadFxml​(java.lang.String fxmlPath,
                                   java.lang.Object controller)
        Loads an FXML file from the given fxmlPath, setting controller as its backing controller.
        Parameters:
        fxmlPath - the path to the FXML file
        controller - the controller to set
        Returns:
        the loaded Node instance

      • loadFxml

                                   java.lang.Object controller,
                                   java.util.ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
        Loads an FXML file from the given fxmlPath, setting controller as its backing controller.
        Parameters:
        fxmlPath - the path to the FXML file
        controller - the controller to set
        resourceBundle - the resource bundle that shall be used for localization
        Returns:
        the loaded Node instance

        public static void addAccelerator​(javafx.scene.control.ButtonBase button,
                                  javafx.scene.input.KeyCodeCombination keyCodeCombination)
        Adds an accelerator (keyboard shortcut) to the supplied button.
        Parameters:
        button - the button to add an accelerator to
        keyCodeCombination - the key combination that will trigger the action behind the button

      • removeAccelerators

        public static void removeAccelerators​(javafx.scene.Scene scene)
        Removes all accelerators from a given scene.
        Parameters:
        scene - the scene

      • runInFxThread

        public static void runInFxThread​(java.lang.Runnable runnable)
        Executes the given Runnable in the JavaFX thread. In case the current thread already is the JavaFX thread, the Runnable.run() method is directly invoked.
        Parameters:
        runnable - the runnable to execute inside the JavaFX thread

      • runInFxThreadAndWait

        public static <T> T runInFxThreadAndWait​(javafx.concurrent.Task<T> task)
                                  throws java.lang.InterruptedException,
                                         java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException
        Invokes a javafx.concurrent.Task in the JavaFX Thread and waits while it's finished. Like SwingUtilities.invokeAndWait does for EDT.
        Parameters:
        task - the runnable that has to be called on JavaFX thread.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - f the execution is interrupted.
        java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException - If a exception is occurred in the run method of the Runnable

                                                   javafx.collections.ObservableList<?> list)
        Creates a binding which enables the given button, when the list contains elements.
        Parameters:
        button - the button to enable
        list - the list that shall be checked for elements

      • enableButtonWhenAllControlsHaveValues

        public static void enableButtonWhenAllControlsHaveValues​(javafx.scene.control.Button button,
                                                         javafx.scene.control.Control... controls)
        Enable the given button, when the controls have values supplied.

        Supported controls are: TextInputControl (e.g. TextField and TextArea).

        Parameters:
        button - the button to enable
        controls - the controls to check

      • enableButtonWhenConditionIsMet

        public static void enableButtonWhenConditionIsMet​(javafx.scene.control.Button button,
                                                  javafx.beans.property.BooleanProperty condition)
        Enables the given button, when the supplied condition property changes to true.
        Parameters:
        button - the button to enable
        condition - the condition to observe

      • enableButtonWhenPropertyHasExpectValue

        public static void enableButtonWhenPropertyHasExpectValue​(javafx.scene.control.Button button,
                                                          javafx.beans.property.IntegerProperty integerProperty,
                                                          int expectedValue)
        Creates a binding which enables the given button, when the supplied integer value is equal to an expected value.
        Parameters:
        button - the button to enable
        integerProperty - the integer property to observe
        expectedValue - the expected value, when the button shall be enabled

      • getScrollbarComponent

        public static javafx.scene.control.ScrollBar getScrollbarComponent​(javafx.scene.control.Control control,
                                                                   javafx.geometry.Orientation orientation)
        Looks up the first found scrollbar of a given control matching the desired orientation. If none found, null is returned
        Parameters:
        control - the control that is supposed to contain the scrollbar to search for
        orientation - the scrollbar orientation (i.e. vertical or horizontal)
        Returns:
        the found scrollbar, or null, if there is no scrollbar.

        Loads an image from the supplied classpathLocation.
        Parameters:
        classpathLocation - the classpath location to load from
        Returns:
        the loaded image
